instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-2 powers on wont boot to OS
threads.message:
liquid damage along the back edge of the motherboard. 
computer powers on but wont boot to the os. progress bar reaches 100% and it will just hang. 
some components broke of when i tried to clean the corrosion. <RESISTOR>R1690</RESISTOR>,1638 and <CAPACITOR>C3285</CAPACITOR>. 
cleaning ME reign medusa gave me an error.
also got errors when trying to clear $SVS block.
medusa can read the rom with no errors but it doesnt seem to be able to write back.
medusa guy said that the error was due to the rom not getting enough power.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is 3.3v
pin 8 on <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> is 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-2 powers on wont boot to OS
threads.message:
I recommend to disconnect power from MacBook board when using Medusa.
Inject external 3.3V on <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> rail instead.
I never got problems in this way.
I recommend you try complete new BIOS, known as good.
You can clean ME region with Medusa, when is charged in the SPI chip.
If you change SSN, remember to fix checksum after.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-2 powers on wont boot to OS
threads.message:
I dont have a power supply for injecting voltage. 
Would there be anything else i can do to determine if its an issue with the rom chip itself before buying more equipment? 
Would be be possible to tap into another 3.3v line on the board? or is that to risky.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-2 powers on wont boot to OS
threads.message:
If J6100 is corroded, you cannot read BIOS at all.
As you read it, that is not the problem.
This happened to me too and solved the problem using external power supply...
